results.description: After using apt-get install, it is needed to delete apt-get lists

data.queryName: Apt Get Install Lists Were Not Deleted
data.queryUrl: Apt Get Install Lists Were Not Deleted [Taken from query_name]
data.expectedValue: After using apt-get install, the apt-get lists should be deleted
data.value: After using apt-get install, the apt-get lists were not deleted

results.description: Check if any apt-get installs don't use '--no-install-recommends' flag to avoid installing additional packages.

data.queryUrl: APT-GET Not Avoiding Additional Packages [Taken from query_name]
data.expectedValue: 'RUN  apt-get update &&   apt-get --yes install vim nano gzip' uses '--no-install-recommends' flag to avoid installing additional packages
data.value: 'RUN  apt-get update &&   apt-get --yes install vim nano gzip' does not use '--no-install-recommends' flag to avoid installing additional packages

results.description: The web application's cleanup method creates a cookie cookie, at line 9 of /src/main/resources/lessons/spoofcookie/js/handler.js, and returns it in the response. However, the application is not configured to automatically set the cookie with the "httpOnly" attribute, and the code does not explicitly add this to the cookie.

The application uses the hard-coded password password for authentication purposes, either using it to verify users' identities, or to access another remote system. This password at line 91 of /src/test/java/org/owasp/webgoat/lessons/spoofcookie/SpoofCookieAssignmentTest.java appears in the code, implying it is accessible to anyone with source code access, and cannot be changed without rebuilding the application.
Method Lambda in /src/main/resources/lessons/challenges/js/bootstrap.min.js, at line 620, calls an obsolete API, isWindow. This has been deprecated, and should not be used in a modern codebase.
Method Lambda in /src/main/resources/lessons/challenges/js/bootstrap.min.js, at line 321, calls an obsolete API, proxy. This has been deprecated, and should not be used in a modern codebase.

Method  at line 31 of /src/main/java/org/owasp/webgoat/lessons/xxe/User.java defines password, which is designated to contain user passwords. However, while plaintext passwords are later assigned to password, this variable is never cleared from memory.
Method Cx1e849fc1 in /src/main/resources/webgoat/static/js/libs/bootstrap.min.js, at line 149, calls an obsolete API, proxy. This has been deprecated, and should not be used in a modern codebase.

The application uses the hard-coded password JWT_PASSWORD for authentication purposes, either using it to verify users' identities, or to access another remote system. This password at line 62 of /src/main/java/org/owasp/webgoat/lessons/jwt/JWTRefreshEndpoint.java appears in the code, implying it is accessible to anyone with source code access, and cannot be changed without rebuilding the application.

Method logRequest at line 46 of /src/main/java/org/owasp/webgoat/lessons/xxe/Ping.java gets user input from element text. This element’s value flows through the code without being properly sanitized or validated, and is eventually used in writing an audit log in logRequest at line 49 of /src/main/java/org/owasp/webgoat/lessons/xxe/Ping.java.

This may enable Log Forging.
